meanings.definition: To put together again; to gather or fit together again.
meanings.sent1: I am reassembling my toy car after it broke apart.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys reassembling puzzles in her free time.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept reassembling itself every time it fell apart.
meanings.sent4: The team is reassembling their strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic is reassembling the engine with precision and care.

meanings.definition: The act of putting something back together.
meanings.sent1: The reassembling of the vase was done carefully to avoid any further damage.
meanings.sent2: After the earthquake, the reassembling of the buildings began.
meanings.sent3: The reassembling of the jigsaw puzzle brought a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent4: The reassembling of the broken mirror reflected the girl's determination.
meanings.sent5: The reassembling of the old clock was a challenging but rewarding task.
